intro: Bryonia acuta, commonly known as the acute bryony, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and squashes, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into spiny, orange-brown fruits. Its roots and leaves contain toxic compounds, including alkaloids, making it a plant with both medicinal and hazardous properties. It thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along roadsides.
